org.jtrim2.image.transform

Class BasicImageTransformations

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim2.image.transform.BasicImageTransformations

  • public final class BasicImageTransformations
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a subset of commonly used 2D affine transformations. The transformation is defined by the following properties: rotate, flip, scale and offset. The offset property is intended to be applied after other transformations have been applied.

    Note that this class is only a subset of the possible affine transformations and cannot define an arbitrary affine transformation.

    This class does not have a public constructor. You can create instances of BasicImageTransformations through BasicImageTransformations.Builder or by one of the factory methods. For example: 

     BasicImageTransformations.Builder builder = new BasicImageTransformations.Builder();
 builder.setRotateInDegrees(90);
 builder.setZoom(2.0);
 return builder.create();

    The above code returns a transformations which rotates by 90 degrees clockwise and magnifies the image to twice the original size in both dimensions.

    Thread safety

    Instances of this class are completely immutable and therefore safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this class are synchronization transparent.
    See Also:
    BasicImageTransformations.Builder, identityTransformation(), newOffsetTransformation(double, double), newRotateTransformation(double), newZoomTransformation(double, double)

    • Field Detail

      • RAD_0

        public static final double RAD_0
        Defines 0 degree in radians. When 0 degree is set for a BasicImageTransformations, then the getRotateInRadians() method will return exactly this double value.
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • identityTransformation

        public static BasicImageTransformations identityTransformation()
        Returns the identity transformation. That is, a transformation with the following properties:
        • RotateInRadians (and RotateInDegrees) == 0
        • FlipHorizontal == false
        • FlipVertical == false
        • ZoomX == 1.0
        • ZoomY == 1.0
        • OffsetX == 0.0
        • OffsetY == 0.0
        Returns:
        the identity transformation. This method never returns null.

      • newZoomTransformation

        public static BasicImageTransformations newZoomTransformation(double zoomX,
                                                              double zoomY)
        Returns a transformation which is the same as the identity transformation except for the scaling properties. That is, a transformation with the following properties:
        • RotateInRadians (and RotateInDegrees) == 0
        • FlipHorizontal == false
        • FlipVertical == false
        • ZoomX == zoomX (as requested)
        • ZoomY == zoomY (as requested)
        • OffsetX == 0.0
        • OffsetY == 0.0
        Parameters:
        zoomX - the multiplier applied to the width of the image
        zoomY - the multiplier applied to the height of the image
        Returns:
        a transformation with the specified scaling properties. This method never returns null.

      • newOffsetTransformation

        public static BasicImageTransformations newOffsetTransformation(double offsetX,
                                                                double offsetY)
        Returns a transformation which is the same as the identity transformation except for the offset properties. That is, a transformation with the following properties:
        • RotateInRadians (and RotateInDegrees) == 0
        • FlipHorizontal == false
        • FlipVertical == false
        • ZoomX == 1.0
        • ZoomY == 1.0
        • OffsetX == offsetX (as requested)
        • OffsetY == offsetY (as requested)
        Parameters:
        offsetX - the value defining translating along the horizontal axis
        offsetY - the value defining translating along the vertical axis
        Returns:
        a transformation with the specified offset properties. This method never returns null.

      • newRotateTransformation

        public static BasicImageTransformations newRotateTransformation(double rotateInRads)
        Returns a transformation which is the same as the identity transformation except for the rotate property. That is, a transformation with the following properties:
        • RotateInRadians == rotateInRads (as requested).
        • FlipHorizontal == false
        • FlipVertical == false
        • ZoomX == 1.0
        • ZoomY == 1.0
        • OffsetX == 0.0
        • OffsetY == 0.0
        Parameters:
        rotateInRads - the required rotation in radians
        Returns:
        a transformation with the specified offset properties. This method never returns null.

      • isFlipHorizontal

        public boolean isFlipHorizontal()
        Returns true if the image needs to be flipped horizontally. That is, the left side of the image need to be the right side of the image.
        Returns:
        true if the image needs to be flipped horizontally, false otherwise

      • isFlipVertical

        public boolean isFlipVertical()
        Returns true if the image needs to be flipped vertically. That is, the top side of the image need to be the bottom side of the image.
        Returns:
        true if the image needs to be flipped vertically, false otherwise

      • getOffsetX

        public double getOffsetX()
        Returns the offset along the horizontal axis. Note that the offset is to be applied after zoom has been applied.
        Returns:
        the offset along the horizontal axis

      • getOffsetY

        public double getOffsetY()
        Returns the offset along the vertical axis. Note that the offset is to be applied after zoom has been applied.
        Returns:
        the offset along the vertical axis

      • getRotateInDegrees

        public int getRotateInDegrees()
        Returns the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in degrees. As the angle increases, the image need to be rotated clockwise. The zero angle means that the image is not rotated at all.
        Returns:
        the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in degrees. This method returns always returns a normalized angle. That is, a value which is greater than or equal to zero and less than (not equal) to 360.

      • getRotateInRadians

        public double getRotateInRadians()
        Returns the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in radians. As the angle increases, the image need to be rotated clockwise. The zero angle means that the image is not rotated at all.

        Notice that this property is an int, if you need better precision, use the getRotateInRadians() method. This method will round the value to the closest integer.

        Returns:
        the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in radians. This method returns always returns a normalized angle. That is, a value between 0 and 2*pi or NaN if NaN was set.

      • getZoomX

        public double getZoomX()
        Returns the scaling factor used to scale the image horizontally. For example: If this method returns 2.0, the image must be scaled to an image which has twice the width of the original image. Respectively, a value of 0.5 means that the resulting image must be scaled to an image which has half the width of the original image.

        This method may return a negative value which should be interpreted as flipping the image horizontally and scaling with the absolute value.

        The client code should also expect that this property might be zero, NaN or even infinity. How these special values are handled are left to the client code.

        Returns:
        the scaling factor used to scale the image horizontally

      • getZoomY

        public double getZoomY()
        Returns the scaling factor used to scale the image vertically. For example: If this method returns 2.0, the image must be scaled to an image which has twice the height of the original image. Respectively, a value of 0.5 means that the resulting image must be scaled to an image which has half the height of the original image.

        This method may return a negative value which should be interpreted as flipping the image vertically and scaling with the absolute value.

        The client code should also expect that this property might be zero, NaN or even infinity. How these special values are handled are left to the client code.

        Returns:
        the scaling factor used to scale the image vertically

      • isIdentity

        public boolean isIdentity()
        Returns true if this transformation defines the identity transformation. That is, the same value as equals(identityTransformation()).

        Notice that two distinct BasicImageTransformations may define the same transformation with different properties (due to flipping). This method takes this into account.

        Returns:
        true if this transformation defines the identity transformation, false otherwise

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hash code value compatible with the equals method, usable in hash tables.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the hash code value of this object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Checks if the specified object is a BasicImageTransformations and defines the same transformation as this BasicImageTransformations.

        Notice that two distinct BasicImageTransformations may define the same transformation with different properties (due to flipping). This method takes this into account.

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to which this BasicImageTransformation is to be compared to. This argument can be null, in which case the return value is false.
        Returns:
        true if the specified object is a BasicImageTransformations and defines the same transformation as this BasicImageTransformations, false otherwise

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the string representation of this transformation in no particular format

        This method is intended to be used for debugging only.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the string representation of this object in no particular format. This method never returns null.
